data.event: The population was 18,275 at the 2010 census and was estimated at 22,159 in 2014.

event.title: was permanently settled by Mormon pioneers in 1847

data.event: Originally known as "North Cottonwood", Farmington was permanently settled by Mormon pioneers in 1847.
The Children's Primary Association of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints was organized here on 11 August 1878.
Lagoon Amusement Park was founded here in 1886 and occupies 100 acres (0.40 km2) of the city.
